intro: Pavetta urophylla, commonly known as the white pavetta, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
